meanings.definition: Planting something again in a new location.
meanings.sent1: She replants the flowers in a bigger pot.
meanings.sent2: He always replants the trees after a storm.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel replants the acorns in the garden for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting fresh replants hope in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully replants the delicate seedlings to ensure their growth.

meanings.sent1: They replant the vegetables every spring.
meanings.sent2: After the harvest, farmers replant the fields for the next season.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully replant the fallen leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent4: His decision to replant his dreams in a new career path paid off.
meanings.sent5: The gardener replants the wilting flowers to revive their beauty.

meanings.definition: The act of planting something again.
meanings.sent1: The replants in the garden bring new life to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: Each year, the replants in the park attract many visitors.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected replants in the forest puzzled the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The replants in the abandoned field symbolize renewal and growth.
meanings.sent5: The community project focuses on the replants to improve the environment.
